New Records: Ketel Marte had a record 20-game postseason hit streak to begin his career.
Ketel Marte extended his on-base streak to 21 games, tied with Daniel Murphy’s 21 games from 2015-17 for the second-longest such streak to begin a postseason career.
Key Match Events: The Rangers had a 10-0 lead after three innings in Game 4 of the World Series and won 11-7 to take a 3-1 Series lead.
Corey Seager’s two-run homer in the ninth inning and Adolis García’s walk-off homer in the 11th in Game 1 loss.
Christian Walker mishandled a ball that led to a five-run third inning in Game 4.
Center fielder Alek Thomas overran a ball in the ninth in Game 5, allowing a run to score in the four-run inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Diamondbacks accelerated the timeline, shaking up the baseball world with an extended postseason stay.
Manager Torey Lovullo said: “You want to be the last team standing. You want to be in the middle of a pile and have everybody pile on top of you. That’s the best feeling in the world,”
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Torey Lovullo said: “We weren’t playing freely defensively and you see what happens when you make mistakes like that. You do it against good teams on this level In the final series of the year, it compounds itself and led to some crooked numbers.”
Christian Walker said: “There’s always going to be things to look back and wish it turned out differently. But at the end of the day, we gave everything we had and there’s no regrets.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Diamondbacks had one of baseball’s best defenses during the regular season, yet faltered at key moments in the World Series.

A breakthrough season ended in a desert disappointment, but the Diamondbacks are in a prime position for the long haul with a young core of players who now know what it takes to get to that big stage.
Others: The Rangers exposed Arizona’s weaknesses in the Fall Classic.
Zac Gallen struggled early in the postseason, losing the form that put him in contention for the NL Cy Young Award.
